farm: Eoliennes Offshore du Calvados project
content: Awarded the tender for the development of the Eoliennes Offshore du Calvados project.

farm: Eoliennes Offshore du Calvados project
content: Éolien Maritime France (EMF) holds an 85% share of the project. EMF is jointly co-owned by EDF Energies Nouvelles and Enbridge.

farm: Eoliennes Offshore du Calvados project

farm: Eoliennes Offshore du Calvados project

farm: Eoliennes Offshore du Calvados project
content: Supply the Haliade 150 6MW model to the project. Generators and Nacelles to be made in Saint-Nazaire. Blades and Towers to be made in Cherbourg. Alstom sold their energy business to GE.

farm: Eoliennes Offshore du Calvados project
content: ABB will supply 400-megavolt ampere (MVA) booster transformers for onshore substations to help regulate the voltage of power transmitted.

farm: Eoliennes Offshore du Calvados project
content: Ramboll designed the monopile foundations for Saint-Nazaire and Courseulles-sur-Mer.

farm: Eoliennes Offshore du Calvados project
content: Prysmian will be responsible for the design, supply, installation, testing and commissioning of two HV export power cable links for each of the three offshore wind farms covering both the submarine and land routes to connect Fécamp, Calvados and St Nazaire to the French network. The submarine cable links, which consist of High Voltage Alternating Current (HVAC) 220 kV three-core cables with XLPE insulation and single wire armouring, will connect the offshore wind parks being developed by Eolien Maritime France (EMF). Prysmian intend to use the Cable Enterprise and the submarine cables will be produced in the Group’s centres of excellence in Arco Felice, Italy and Pikkala, Finland. The cables for the land sections will be manufactured in Gron, France.

content: This company was created after the GDF-led consortium were announced as the winners of the bid.

farm: Parc des Iles d’Yeu et de Noirmoutier

farm: Parc des Iles d’Yeu et de Noirmoutier
content: Part of the winning consortium consisting of GDF SUEZ, EDP Renewables, Neoen Marine and AREVA. Previous reports have suggested that the ownership breakdown is GDF 47%, EDP 43% and Neoen 10%.

farm: Parc des Iles d’Yeu et de Noirmoutier
content: La Caisse des Dépôts acquired the shares of Neoen Marine in April 2016

farm: Parc des Iles d’Yeu et de Noirmoutier
content: Siemens Gamesa Renewable Energy (SGRE) and subsidiary Adwen France SAS announced that SGRE will now supply its 8 MW D8 offshore wind turbine to the Yeu-Noirmoutier and Dieppe-Le Tréport offshore wind projects in France to replace Adwen's AD8 model which has been discontinued. This decision has been approved by the Ministry for Ecological and Solidarity Transition.

farm: Parc des Iles d’Yeu et de Noirmoutier
content: Les Eoliennes en Mer Services has chosen consulting engineering company, NIRAS to set a plan for decommissioning.  Niras previously assisted LEMS in de-risking future dismantling and has used the ODIN (Offshore, Decommissioning of Installations Niras) tool to create the decommissioning plan for two french projects;  Éoliennes en mer Dieppe et Le Tréport and the Iles d’Yeu et de Noirmoutier projects.

farm: Parc des Iles d’Yeu et de Noirmoutier
content: LICengineering was selected as Engineer for two offshore windfarms in France, Noirmoutier windfarm and Le Tréport Windfarm by Les Eolienne en Mer (LEM) on 16th August 2017.

farm: Parc des Iles d’Yeu et de Noirmoutier
content: On 24th August 2017, ODE and DORIS Engineering were awarded the Owners Engineer contracts covering the Wind Turbine Generator Installation and the Marine Construction Management for the Éoliennes en mer Dieppe et Le Tréport and the Iles d’Yeu et de Noirmoutier wind farms.

farm: Parc des Iles d’Yeu et de Noirmoutier

farm: Parc éolien en mer de Fécamp
content: Install the prototype concrete foundation from Seatower. The installation only requires towing vessels to sail the foundation out to sea and it is lowered onto the seabed by filling it with water.

content: Prysmian will be responsible for the design, supply, installation, testing and commissioning of two HV export power cable links for each of the three offshore wind farms covering both the submarine and land routes to connect Fécamp, Calvados and St Nazaire to the French network. The submarine cable links, which consist of High Voltage Alternating Current (HVAC) 220 kV three-core cables with XLPE insulation and single wire armouring, will connect the offshore wind parks being developed by Eolien Maritime France (EMF). Prysmian intend to use the Cable Enterprise and the submarine cables will be produced in the Group’s centres of excellence in Arco Felice, Italy and Pikkala, Finland. The cables for the land sections will be manufactured in Gron, France.

content: RTE to provide grid connection, which will account for approximately 10% of the project's investment
